ray.renderer

Class BruteForcePathTracer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.renderer.DirectOnlyRenderer
      • ray.renderer.PathTracer
        • ray.renderer.BruteForcePathTracer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Renderer

    public class BruteForcePathTracer
extends PathTracer
    A renderer that computes radiance recursively. It assumes a maximum recursive depth specified by PathTracer.depthLimit. Therefore, if the light ray has been scattered by certain times, we assume all the energy has been lost.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class ray.renderer.PathTracer

    • Method Detail

      • rayRadianceRecursive

        protected void rayRadianceRecursive(Scene scene,
                                    Ray ray,
                                    SampleGenerator sampler,
                                    int sampleIndex,
                                    int level,
                                    Color outColor)
        Evaluates the illumination component recursively, this method is called by PathTracer.rayRadiance(Scene, Ray, SampleGenerator, int, Color) method.
        Specified by:
        rayRadianceRecursive in class PathTracer
        Parameters:
        scene - scene to be rendered
        ray - the recursive ray along which we compute the radiance
        sampler - the sampler is used to generate random numbers for sampling rays
        sampleIndex - index of the currently sampled ray in a pixel. The index value will be used in SampleGenerator.sample(int, int, Point2) method.
        level - current recursive depth
        outColor - output radiance for each RGB channel
